title: Montana Ranch Andie MacDowell Once Owned Lists for $7.775 Million; The 457-acre property's current owner, a former Microsoft executive, added a bunk room to the 8,000-square-foot barn that sleeps 12
text:
The Audinos purchased the property from Ms. MacDowell in March 2000 for an undisclosed sum; it had been listed for $3.5 million in 1998.

Ms. MacDowell and her then-husband had renovated the 1930s hand-cut-log main house, which has three bedrooms and three bathrooms. They also built an 8,000-square-foot barn with living and workspace, according to Mr. Audino. There is also a separate guest cabin.

"The combination of the three create a really rustic and warm environment," Mr. Audino, 62, said. Ms. MacDowell couldn't be reached for comment.

The Audinos, based in Washington state, have four children and used the property for family and friend gatherings. They added a bunk room to the barn that sleeps 12. "It will sleep 30 people across the property," he said.

Amenities include an indoor basketball court, a sand volleyball court, an in-ground trampoline, a stone fire pit and about 15 acres of irrigated lawn. The land includes irrigated meadows, a forest and 1.25 miles of frontage along Ninemile Creek. There is also a hand-cleared, private hiking trail through a cedar grove.

The Audinos are selling as their children are grown. "We're embracing the next chapter, and we'd love it to go to a family that can appreciate it as much as we have," Mr. Audino said. It is listed with Bill McDavid, director and real-estate partner of the brokerage Hall and Hall.
